Author: Patziggy#9371
Content: As a non-developer I love learning what I can from you guys. You always have super informative and helpful discussions! Does anyone have info regarding run time forks and what benefits they offer to the ecosystem? Thanks in advance, friends ğŸ˜„

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a runtime fork is an independent chain that uses the same komodod binary

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: coins like VRSC and PIRATE are just two such

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: VRSC's lead dev already integrated sapling among half a dozen other technical advances and this codebase will come back so it will then be available to the other runtime forks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: PIRATE is an all zaddr chain and it is getting an external infrastructure in place to support all zaddr environments and once that is done other coins in the ecosystem benefit

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: each new project in the ecosystem adds some unique value and the entire ecosystem then gets the benefit of this directly or indirectly

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is called ecosytem for a reason

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we have many coins that are mining coins, that creates a group of miners in the community, who when asked have helped chains that got diff stranded to get back to normal difficulty

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I could go on and on and on
